file_content.text: Now, now--if you'd like to make a purchase, you'll have to go out front.
Stay awhile, Cipher. Enjoy your time on our little planet.
I expect a full report as soon as possible, station chief.
Of course, of course, of course! As soon as things have calmed down--
Ha! What have we here?
If it isn't the Cipher herself, come triumphantly to our doorstep. I was just telling our Keeper about you!
If it isn't the Cipher himself, come triumphantly to our doorstep. I was just telling our Keeper about you!
Am I interrupting a meeting?
So I see.
No. We were finishing up.
I don't understand.
Renald? Summarize the situation for Cipher Nine.
I'm glad I can make story time entertaining.
There's a lot to tell.
Indeed, indeed.
We intercepted unusual communications from the Republic forces alluding to one of their people being assassinated.
Well, before Sanju Pyne died, he sent us some fascinating data. We put the pieces together and realized that you'd killed Gray Star!
I wish we hadn't lost your mole in the process. Sanju shouldn't have died.
I'm sorry about Sanju.
No matter. Sacrifices must be made, I know.
Well, Sanju Pyne confirmed it--Gray Star dead, killed by your own hand! A very fine day indeed.
It wasn't an easy job, but it was necessary.
It had to be done.
Sanju was a great asset. He deserves credit.
I couldn't have done it alone.
I'll make sure he's compensated when he makes it back, then.
I can still smell his blood on my clothes.
It was gory work.
Well, that should wash right out, eh?
Without Gray Star, the surviving terrorists will run amok for a few weeks--but soon enough, we'll round them all up.
You surprised us all with your gift, Cipher--Gray Star coming to us, offering to surrender!
He made some demands for leniency and rambled about "his people," but he was cooperating! Quite a day.
He agreed to surrender only if there were no reprisals.
Those were his conditions.
You do plan to abide by his terms? No reprisals, mercy for the cell members....
You'll do as he asks, I hope?
Indeed. And why aggravate him? So long as Gray Star's helping us, we can afford to throw the man a bone.
Gray Star would've believed anything I told him. He was a fool.
What an idiot.
A fool, perhaps, but a crafty fool. And now he belongs to us. It won't take long to round up his followers.
You gave us quite a prize, Cipher. The terror cell under our control... Gray Star captured and replaced by Sanju Pyne, of all people!
I never dreamed we'd see such success. But Sanju has already begun sending orders, and the terrorists now unwittingly serve us.
Now that the cell's under your control, how do you intend to use it?
What's the plan for them?
Is Sanju managing alright? There's a lot of pressure on him.
How's the kid holding up?
The boy's fine, just fine! A bit overwhelmed maintaining two identities at once, but we'll guide him through it.
All thanks to me.
The credit is yours, of course.
For the time being, Sanju will use the Gray Star persona to gather information and turn the terrorists against the Republic.
As time goes on, we may find other uses for the terrorists. But that's another discussion.
The Balmorran cell is no longer a threat. The other cells in the Eagle's network will no longer receive fresh recruits and supplies from this world.
Then the operation was successful.
That's excellent.
That's correct.
Any news on our primary target?
What about the Eagle?
Progress is being made, but now is not the time for that discussion.
Hard to believe those people were ever a threat.
This cell was a joke.
Those people helped destroy an Imperial dreadnaught and assassinate Darth Jadus. They were a deadly threat.
Station Chief Renald will take matters from here. He'll run cleanup and forward any discoveries to headquarters.
When you return to your ship, contact Watcher Two. She will brief you on all new developments and transfer credits to your discretionary accounts.
I'll be on my way shortly.
Understood.
I have other business to take care of on Balmorra.
I can't leave quite yet.
Make it fast. This planet may be secure, but the Eagle is still at large.
More money sounds good.
You might be in the wrong line of work then, eh?
Good work once again, Cipher Nine. Keeper out.
That man hides it well, but the strain's getting to him--probably worried the Dark Council will skin him alive.
I'm not sure what you're talking about.
What?
He looked fine to me. You're just imagining things.
I think you're wrong.
I'd be worried too, if I were Keeper.
Hard to blame him.
Make no mistake: I don't hold him responsible for what happened, but Darth Jadus was assassinated on his watch.
Ah, but now's no time to discuss politics. You deserve a moment of celebration, and I have work to do.
I'll let you get to it, then.
Very well.
Safe journey, young Cipher.
Thanks, Renald.
Indeed, my friend. Indeed.
Glad to be leaving this mudball.
Guess I can finally leave.
Give it twenty years, my friend. Twenty years, and we'll make this a true Imperial world yet!
Not bad, agent. Not bad at all. You and me--we're going places.
Now off with you! And... good luck.
Posing as a terrorist is a dangerous game. I hope it goes well.
Well, what have we here? Let me take a look at you!
Splendid. No one ever suspects an alien. I'm glad Keeper finally sent someone; pity it took disaster to get headquarters' attention.
You're one of Keeper's girls, eh? I'm glad he finally sent someone; pity it took disaster to get headquarters' attention.
You're one of Keeper's boys, eh? I'm glad he finally sent someone; pity it took disaster to get headquarters' attention.
You must be Station Chief Renald.
Good to meet you.
At your service. I've been assigned to Balmorra for almost twenty years and haven't enjoyed a day of it. Ha!
You're talking about the attack on Dromund Kaas?
Disaster?
Disaster's the only word for it! Thousands dead, a Dark Council member assassinated--hard to believe the Empire's come to this.
You sound like you're familiar with the director.
You know Keeper?
Keeper and I go back. I knew him before--well, before he was Keeper. Wouldn't trust him if my life depended on it, though.
Ha! I kid, of course. Keeper's a good sort.
But here, I'm being a poor host--have a drink, settle in after your trip. This shop doesn't look like much, but it is secure.
Cut out the small talk.
You're reminding me of Keeper already. Very well.
This terror cell you're after--worse than the Republic. Homegrown. They use bombings and sabotage to show their distaste for Imperial rule.
Punishing the civilian population doesn't seem to deter them, but if we can take out the local leader, the cell should fall apart.
Secure or not, this is an odd place to work from.
What is the shop, anyway?
The shop's a front--a necessary deception. The Republic and the terrorists have people everywhere.
Rather than calling secret informants into a military base, I speak to them here, and no one's the wiser.
Do you always imbibe on the job?
You're drinking already?
And I suppose you've never sat in a cantina with a glass of Luranian brandy, hoping your cover hasn't been blown?
Ours is a dangerous profession, agent. We all find ways to take the edge off. But, on to business.
These terrorists you're after--they've been a thorn in my side for a long while. They're worse than the Republic in some ways.
So they're not working with the Republic?
I figured they were together.
Oh?
Familiarity. The terrorists know Balmorra; the Republic doesn't--at least not as well.
"Worse than the Republic"? Is that your explanation for why they're still operational?
That sounds like an excuse.
I make no excuses.
This terror cell is homegrown, made up of Balmorrans unhappy with the Empire's rule.
I suspect the Republic tacitly supports the terrorists--we're their common enemy. So we do our best to cope with the bombings and sabotage.
What's your response been so far?
How?
Go on.
I suppose you just sit back and wait for their attacks.
That's it? You cope?
Don't be absurd. The terrorists don't announce their plans in advance, so there's little we can do.
The governor makes an example of a few dozen Balmorrans after each attack--but it doesn't have much of an effect.
Meanwhile, I've been studying the terror cell's structure--and there's good news. If we can take out the local leader, the cell should fall apart.
What do we know about this person?
The leader?
What makes you so sure?
Really?
Experience, agent. Experience and age.
You have this plan, but you haven't actually implemented it.
Yet you've failed.
Yes, well... we don't know exactly who the leader is.
The terrorists call the man in charge "Gray Star." He runs the cell, gives the orders and knows all the secrets.
They claim Gray Star used to work with the Eagle, but who can be sure? Only the high-ranking cell members know Gray Star's identity.
It's a complication, but there's opportunity there.
I can work with that.
Do you have any theories about Gray Star?
I could use more information.
I don't need more theories. I need proof.
We can capture a cell member and bring out the torture droids. That should get us what we need.
Time for an interrogation.
Messy, agent. Very messy--and likely to alert our quarry, besides. I propose another stratagem.
I have a mole inside the terrorist cell already. He's a good lad--no Cipher, though.
He can bring you in. You'd have the opportunity to impress the terrorists, win their trust....
...and gain access to their leader.
We could get in close....
Precisely! Gray Star will be ours.
You expect me to pose as a terrorist?
You're serious?
Isn't that what Cipher agents do?
Win their trust, then shoot them. Got it.
Easy plan.
Just don't forget to find Gray Star before the shooting starts, eh?
Sanju Pyne--my operative--can introduce you to the terrorist recruiters at the Troida Military Workshop, outside the safe zone.
But be careful how you present yourself. If the terrorists suspect you're Imperial, you'll lose Gray Star... and your lives.
Something I can help you with?
We've still got a terror cell to defeat, Cipher. You and me, together!
Cipher Nine! Pleasure to see you again--Sanju reports you've made contact with the terror cell.
But that's not what I'm calling about. Apparently, Imperial Intelligence considers me a glorified secretary--they want me to get a message to you. Ha!
Who's the message from?
Oh?
I'm in the middle of an operation.
This is a bad time.
I should hope so, but all things stand still for the might of Intelligence headquarters.
Just give me the message, Renald.
Skip the commentary.
Relaying the transmission now. You should see the charming young woman who contacted me momentarily.
Thank you, station chief.
Cipher Nine--can you hear me? This is Watcher Two.
I'm analyzing some reports on the Eagle's network, and I want to run something past you.
Things are a little busy. Does it have to be now?
How urgent is this?
That's part of the problem. I'm not sure, and I hate being unsure.
Proceed.
Why would a glorious mind like yours need my input?
You don't usually bother.
All right, Cipher. You caught me. I don't want your opinion--I just need your hands.
I'm seeing indications that terror cells received medical data from Balmorra--genetic sequences, protein codes, that sort of thing.
Balmorra is the last place I'd expect to see terrorists conducting medical research. So it bears investigating.
I can do that.
Where would you expect terrorists to do their research?
"The last place you'd expect"?
Nar Shaddaa, Polis Massa... the pirate strongholds of the Rishi Maze, if they really exist. I won't give you the full list.
You can't stand a mystery, can you?
You must be frustrated.
Mysteries give me headaches. It was bred into me as a motivator.
Before the Empire invaded the planet, there was a genetics research facility not far from the valley. The locals call it "Bugtown."
See if you can discover evidence of terrorists visiting the facility, and find out what--if anything--they may have taken.
This place is called "Bugtown"?
Tell me about the facility.
Something about the experiments performed there. I'm not familiar with the details.
Does this take priority over destroying the Balmorran cell?
What about my main mission?
Absolutely not. This is a secondary objective--but it's still a mystery I'd like solved.
Not a lot to go on--seems like a long shot.
That's a little vague.
Granted. Nonetheless, I'd like you to try.
Bring your findings to Doctor Tepharus at the Sobrik base. He'll report to me.
Oh--and station chief? Thank you for playing "glorified secretary."
It's a privilege to serve my Empire. Lekern out.
